data.title: Vaduz, capital Liechtenstein
data.meta_description: Discover the most beautiful city tours and cultural highlights of the city. Vaduz is the capital and cultural treasury of the Principality of Liechtenstein. Close to the Rhine and the border with Switzerland.
data.text:
The name Vaduz has its origins in the Rhaeto-Romanic language and dates back to the time when the Romans were lords of the province of Rhaetia. The first documented mention dates back to 1150. In 1712 Prince Johann Adam of Liechtenstein acquired the County of Vaduz, and in 1719 Emperor Charles VI united it with the other part of the country, the Lordship of Schellenberg, and elevated the territory to the Imperial Principality of Liechtenstein. Vaduz became the capital of the whole country. Since 1939, Vaduz Castle has been the permanent residence of the Princes von und zu Liechtenstein.

Vaduz Castle towers about 120 meters above the capital Vaduz. It is the landmark of the capital of Liechtenstein and visible from far away. It is not possible to visit the castle, but guided tours in Vaduz and a visit to the Prince's Cinema provide interesting insights into the history of the castle.

Liechtenstein Museum of Art

In the six exhibition halls of the black cube, completed in 2000, exciting exhibitions lead through modern and contemporary art history. The focus is on the state art collection of the Principality of Liechtenstein, complemented by leading temporary exhibitions on international art of the 20th and 21st centuries.

Hilti Art Foundation

Completed in 2015, the extension houses the important Liechtenstein private collection and includes outstanding works of classical modern and contemporary art.

Sculptures in Vaduz

If you have an eye for it, you will notice a multitude of sculptures by world-famous sculptors while strolling through Vaduz. Learn more about the 28 works of art and their creators and enjoy the cultural walk through Vaduz.

Liechtenstein Treasure Chamber

The "Liechtensteinische SchatzKammer" museum in Vaduz is unique in the Alpine region and displays unique objects that are closely associated with Liechtenstein and cannot be found anywhere else in this form and compilation.

Guided city tours through Vaduz

City-ClassicTour - Discover the capital of Liechtenstein on foot. The approximately two-hour tour through Vaduz opens up exciting insights and princely views.

City-BackstageTour - Take a look behind the scenes of the small princely state. Between direct democracy and monarchy, this system is unique worldwide and has been a successful model for 150 years.

CityTrain & Liechtenstein Treasures - On the St√§dtle Tour you will explore Vaduz in the Citytrain, with all its charm. During the ride you will learn the most important facts about the country, the Princely House, historical and current events. Afterwards you will visit the SchatzKammer...

Liechtenstein-Weg - Discover the 5.4km long section of Vaduz on the Liechtenstein-Weg in the company of a tour guide. Learn many interesting facts about the sights and the diverse culture.

The data will be deleted after processing your request is completed. The request will also be forwarded directly to the host.

Note: You can revoke your consent at any time for the future by sending an e-mail to kontakt@alpen-erleben.com.
